title: Still Serving Great Value in Homewood
text: We are locals and have dined here many times, but not recently. We were glad to see the ambiance, menu and service were essentially unchanged. The menu is classic Italian, with many options. The wine list is short, but of extremely high quality (try the Amarone, it's amazing!). Our server was willing to make a number of changes and substitutions to our orders. Don't let the adjacent construction activity deter you. This little, unassuming restaurant is a true treasure in downtown Homewood. Bon apetite!

title: A Birmingham "Hidden Gem"
text: Seasons 52 is located in the Summit shopping center, a HUGE shopping center located just south of Birmingham off of busy US HWY 280. Birmingham has several iconic fine dining restaurants, and Seasons 52 is on par with those fine establishments. The service is impeccable. The wait staff is knowledgable and professional. Their wine, beer and cocktail list is extensive, diverse, and of high quality. The menu features mostly "seasonal" items, as the name implies. Our party enjoyed sea scallops, sea bass, and filet mignon. All were perfectly prepared and paired with fine wines from the extensive "by the glass" list. They offer their deserts in small, "shot glass" sizes, which is really great after enjoying a large, tasty meal. These folks know what they are doing. Give them a try!

title: Excellent Lunch Menu!
text: We dined here for lunch recently and I was quite impressed. Ferus features dining alongside their beautiful micro-brewery. The space is very open and inviting and the lunch menu is short, but of high quality. Our party of 4 sampled the arugula salad with grilled salmon, fried chicken tenders, grilled cheese sandwich with fries, and the wedge salad. All were outstanding! I highly recommend this new area in Trussville. There are other eateries close by and at times they feature sports on the massive outdoor screen. Enjoy!

title: An Irish "Cheers", with Good Food
text: This cool little bar and grill is located in one of the oldest neighborhoods in downtown/"old" Mobile. The location is literally in a small, but nice, neighborhood, but parking is not an issue. There is a free public parking area located diagonally from the restaurant. This is a bar, ok? Not much of a wine list or food menu, but what they do offer is of high quality at great prices. I had the specialty burger of the day, the "LA Burger", with potato salad and it was awesome! If you want something unique and "off the beaten path", this is your place.

title: Great Seafood and Convenient Location
text: Over the years, we have dined here many times and have never been disappointed. Note that they are located in the heart of a popular vacation spot on Perdido Key, Florida, so the prices are a bit high, especially for dinner. I suggest trying them for lunch with better value and come back for dinner if you are pleased. They offer a diverse, seafood-heavy menu, plus decent wines and craft beers and a full bar. Service is consistently good and they offer indoor and outdoor seating all year long. Also be aware parking can be really challenging, especially during peak season around dinnertime. There are very few "high end" restaurants on Perdido Key, so give them a try!

title: THE Place for Baked Goodies!
text: This tiny, unassuming building houses a GREAT bakery. If on DI, you MUST try this place! They are located a short half block on the left off of the main road as you enter the island from the bridge. The baked goods are outstanding, whether you are looking for a yummy breakfast or just a delicious snack.

title: Great Views and Food on Dauphin Island
text: I have to say I am surprised by some of the poor reviews of this restaurant. I had lunch here and was thoroughly impressed. My server was extremely professional and knowledgable of the food and beverages available here. The views are the very best anywhere on DI, whether you choose to dine downstairs, upstairs, or outside. The menu is quite diverse, with lots of great seafood, burgers and other fare. I had the fried mushroom appetizer, the Pirate Burger (make sure you get their specialty rum sauce), and onion rings. A+ on the food! Their wine list is limited but of high quality. I will be back, and so should you!

title: Great Family-Owned Restaurant
text: Shiki, located in the Hallman Hill condominium building on 19th Street in the SoHo area of Homewood, is simply one of my favorite restaurants in all of Homewood. This small, unassuming place offers consistently great and affordable sushi and Thai food, prepared with the care you would expect from a family run business. We have dined here many times both in the restaurant and via takeout. The service and attention to detail is impeccable. Some of our menu favorites include Spring Rolls, Crab Angels, Seafood Baked Avocado, Squid Salad, and just about all sushi options. They offer indoor and outdoor seating and a nice cocktail menu as well. If you are looking for great Thai or sushi without the usual high prices, please give Shiki your business.

title: Consistently Great, Affordable Fast Food
text: We are locals and simply LOVE this place. It is one of our "go-to" restaurants for simple, affordable, consistently great food. While they are technically "fast food", many of the menu options are actually quite healthy. Our favorite is the chicken salad but the Avocado Smash appetizer, various hummus options, turkey offerings, and the numerous other available entrees are quite good as well. Note they have Family Dinners as well. This Homewood location offers curbside pickup in addition to indoor or outdoor seating and counter pickup. Give them a try and you won't be disappointed.

title: For Chicken Salad Lovers, For Sure!
text: We have a home just a few blocks from this restaurant and have dined here many times, both in the restaurant and via takeout. They offer several variations on the chicken salad theme and other items including turkey, pimento cheese, soups and salads, so there is a little something for everyone. In addition to standard meals, they also offer several items in larger take-home portions. Although a chain, I highly recommend Chicken Salad Chick!

title: Good Mexican Food in SoHo
text: This relatively new restaurant has been a good addition to the downtown SoHo area in my opinion. We are locals and have dined here several times, both in the restaurant and via takeout. We have always found the food to be delicious and professionally prepared, with excellent service to boot. I simply cannot explain the poor reviews they have received. The menu offers several traditional Mexican dishes as well as some unique creations, including a corn and cheese dip. They offer ample outdoor dining as well as spacious indoor seating. As a bonus, their margaritas are yummy!

title: New Location, Really Great Food
text: Locals has moved from their old location to the much fancier location that used to be Pinzone's for many years. Their new location on the "alley" right off of Fairhope Avenue is a significant upgrade. This new location features indoor and outdoor dining options in a really chic setting, featuring live outdoor entertainment in the "alley". The really good news is that the food, which was great at the old location, is actually even better. The upgraded menu has many diverse options and several unique Locals creations. The wine list is outstanding as well. I highly recommend Locals for a great meal any time of day or for just hanging out and having a snack or cocktail. As the many rave reviews suggest, this is clearly one of the best restaurants in all of Baldwin County!

title: Easy Hike To The Falls
text: This free public attraction offers several great hiking options. The easiest is a short (less than one mile) and fairly flat hike through the beautiful mountain woods to the Linville Falls viewing area. It's well worth the walk, but do be sure and wear comfortable, hard soled shoes. After a rain, there will be a few muddy spots and the rocks at the falls can be a bit slippery. There are two other trails for the more adventurous and aggressive hikers. NOTE: If you enjoy a more quiet experience, go very early. This is a popular attraction and gets crowded and noisy on weekends and during the summer vacation period. Parking can also be a real pain when crowded.

title: North Carolina Mountain Beauty and Fun!
text: This public park provides a really easy and convenient way to enjoy the beauty of the North Carolina mountains. The park is spacious with lots of room to spread out. Bring a picnic lunch, venture out with a kayak or canoe rental, enjoy a leisurely walk around the lake, or just soak up God's beauty in this laid back atmosphere. NOTE: Parking here is extremely limited, so go early on weekends or in the summer vacation season. Also, no public restrooms other than the porta-potties so be prepared.

title: Above Average Bar Food
text: This pub, located in the heart of little West Jefferson, is a real find. They specialize in burgers and we found several of the choices to be outstanding. The atmosphere is what you would expect in a sports bar, but the food is better than most such establishments. The service was good and we carried home some takeout to enjoy later as well. Give them a try!

title: Fine Dining in Blowing Rock
text: This restaurant is a nice, homey place in the heart of Blowing Rock. The service was outstanding. We had the pecan crusted goat cheese salad and it was delicious! Reservations are highly suggested. If you are in the area, The Village Cafe is a must do!

title: Good Food - Unfriendly Service
text: It's a good thing the food here is so good, because the service quite frankly sucks. I tried to order over the phone and was rudely rebuffed. I decided to try ordering in person and was able to bring home a really tasty mexican meal including chips with salsa, cheese dip and guacamole, plus enchiladas, a chile relleno, tacos and a burrito. The food was really great! Try and overlook the lousy service and you may enjoy a great Mexican meal.

title: Creative Menu - Very Good Food
text: Compared to other local restaurants, The Painted Fish is a bit pricey but as they say, "you get what you pay for". We did a takeout dinner recently and were so impressed! The smoked trout salad, crab cakes, oyster appetizer and trout entree were outstanding! These folks really know what they are doing, so give them a try.

title: Great Takeout Pizza!
text: We did takeout recently and it was a great experience. The pizza was hot and tasty, very well prepared. The folks at Bella's were quite friendly and professional. Based on this experience, I'm sure we will try dining in at the restaurant in the near future.

title: Great Food - Dine INSIDE for Lunch!
text: We had an amazing lunch here recently. Their menu has some really tasty and creative "takes" on fresh speckled trout, including trout on a fresh salad, trout toast, trout as an entree, and my favorite, trout on a deviled egg! They also have other dishes besides trout which are great as well. Their wine list is full of high quality yet inexpensive options. Our servers were simply outstanding. NOTE: Be aware that the restaurant sits at a major intersection. If you sit outside, be prepared for lots of LOUD trucks and other traffic. I would recommend dining inside if you can.
place: The Speckled Trout Restaurant & Bottle Shop

title: Dog-Friendly Good Food!
text: We so enjoyed our lunch here on a warm July afternoon. The wait staff were so attentive! They brought an ice-water bowl for our puppy while we waited for our table. So thoughtful! Once seated, we picked a wine from their abbreviated yet high quality wine list. The menu is quite diverse for "tavern food", and we enjoyed a great meal of nachos, onion rings, and burgers. I highly recommend Town Tavern, especially if you have a pup with you or simply enjoy dining outdoors.

title: Good BBQ
text: We enjoyed a takeout meal from here and found the food to be quite good. The brisket hamburger, pulled pork sandwich and "combo platter" (ribs, pulled pork, brisket) were all very good. The sides were great as well except for the cole slaw. Too much vinegar and not enough cabbage. Note that they offer several sauces so be sure and ask the particulars about each one when you order.

title: Quality Dining
text: This restaurant is a great find! Situated in "downtown Banner Elk", they offer a high quality dining experience at reasonable prices. They offer indoor and outdoor seating, as well as bar service. The outdoor seating area is really special, with lots of shaded tables. Their menu and wine/cocktail list is extremely diverse, with many fun choices. Three in our party had the sauteed trout and it was outstanding! Their fried catfish was also a hit! The sides are numerous and oh so good as well. If in the area, be sure to make the Banner Elk Cafe one of your stops!

title: GREAT New Fairhope Addition!
text: In a town of numerous great restaurants, Hope Farm is going to give all of them a run for their money for top restaurant in the area. They do "farm to table" cuisine, focusing on local ingredients, and they do it quite well. Our meal of grilled whole snapper, warm mushroom salad (best salad ever!), and local vegetables was outstanding. That said, many restaurants are using that theme these days. There are a number of things that make Hope Farm unique for Fairhope. The space is huge, with indoor and outdoor seating. I assume they will offer to hold large events there as the space can accommodate large parties. The ambiance is "clean, modern, laid back rustic", unlike anything else around. The cocktail and wine list is the best I've seen in the area. The Man o' War cocktail was amazing. Their wines are quite diverse and of great quality, and you can still find great ones by the glass in the $12-15 range. As a local, it is exciting to see a new star come to our local dining scene. Prices are very reasonable given the quality of the fare and overall dining experience. Reservations are highly recommended as they are already quite popular and often crowded.

title: Slowest Drive Through in Fairhope
text: I am a local and have been through the BK drive through MANY times over the past few months and they have richly earned this Terrible rating. Whether there are no cars or a dozen, the wait is always ridiculously long. Know that this pains me as I actually like BK fast food better than most, but the consistently slow service is just too much for me to ignore. There are several other fast food drive throughs close by and I suggest you give one of them a try.

title: Pricey, but Great!
text: Doc's is one of the truly iconic "old" restaurants in Orange Beach. As we are coming out of the COVID shutdown, it warms my heart to see Doc's packed once again. They do fried seafood better than almost anyone on the planet, period! We usually do takeout and are NEVER disappointed. Yes, their prices are higher than some. But as they say, "you get what you pay for". HINT: In high season like now, do a call-in takeout order and enjoy it at home. You'll save lots of time and the food is even better at home, or in your vacation abode. Enjoy!
place: Doc's Seafood Shack and Oyster Bar

title: Gorgeous Views and a History Lesson
text: If you take the time to drive the Fort Morgan Peninsula (along Highway 180/aka Fort Morgan Road) and visit Fort Morgan, you will likely have a day to remember. As you drive out to the end of the peninsula, you will be treated to numerous great views of Little Lagoon, deep woods and the Gulf of Mexico. Along the way is the Bon Secour NWR with a great Nature Center and two great hiking nature trails. At the end of the trail is Fort Morgan, full of wonderful history. You can also hitch a ride on the Mobile Bay Ferry and be treated to a ride across the mouth of Mobile Bay that you will not soon forget. If you are looking to spend a day doing something other than the beach or expensive attractions, give this trail a try.

title: Easy Beach Access
text: This small park, located away from the most crowded Gulf Shores beaches, offers an easy way to access the public beaches and avoid the worst of the crowds. The park is located a short drive west of the main beach access area in Gulf Shores at Little Lagoon Pass, right before you cross the Lee Callaway Bridge. The parking lot is rather small so go early in peak season to secure a spot. They have public restrooms as well. From the parking lot, you can set up your beach day either on the lagoon or on the Gulf of Mexico.

title: A Birder's Dream!
text: As a fairly experienced birder, I have so enjoyed the Alabama Coastal Birding Trail (ACBT). Note that the ACBT consists of over 50 sites in Baldwin County (Orange Beach and Gulf Shores are in Baldwin County) and Mobile County. Several great ACBT sites are in the Orange Beach/Gulf Shores/Gulf State Park areas. I have birded them all and have found it to be some of the best, most diverse birding anywhere in the world. Even if you are not a "birder", a tour of the ACBT will take you to some really beautiful, quiet places where you can relax and enjoy God's gifts of nature to us.

title: Great Views and Fishing Too
text: This rather large pier is a real go to place for locals and visitors. There is a nominal admission fee to access the entire pier, whether just sightseeing or fishing. Many locals and visitors use the pier to nab their favorite Gulf of Mexico seafood from the many fishing vantage points that the pier offers. It is also a great place to watch birds (the pier is one of the sites on the Alabama Coastal Birding Trail) or just enjoy the gorgeous Gulf views.

title: Quiet Short Hike, GREAT Scenery
text: This trail is the short trail in the Bon Secour NWR, and really delivers a lot of "bang for the buck". There is a pretty sizable parking lot and admission is free. This trail is easy to walk or hike and includes several benches to rest upon as you go your way around the trail. The trail includes wonderful deep woods views, as well as a marsh and the coastline of Little Lagoon. There is also a kayak/canoe launch as well. NOTE: There are no restrooms here so plan accordingly. Even at a very leisurely pace, you can hike or walk this trail in 30 minutes to an hour.

title: Serenity On Fort Morgan Peninsula
text: Bon Secour NWR is one of the best kept secrets on the entire Alabama Gulf Coast. The Refuge is located a few miles down the Fort Morgan Peninsula Highway 180 (aka Fort Morgan Road) from Gulf Shores. The Refuge consists of a really nice Nature Center and two great hiking trails. The Jeff Friend Trail is the shorter trail and runs partially along Little Lagoon and also features a kayak/canoe launch. The Pine Beach Trail is the longer trail and is very diverse including deep woods, Little Lagoon and even the Gulf beach area. BSNWR is fantastic for hiking, birding or just enjoying the great outdoors. Whether you are a local or a visitor, invest some time here if you are looking for some diverse outdoor activity away from the crowded beaches and attractions. This would be a great option for spending at least part of a day doing something a bit different from typical "beach vacation" fare. NOTE: As an added bonus, admission is entirely FREE! Also be aware the only public restrooms are at the Nature Center and part of the way down the Pine Beach Trail. There are no restrooms at the Jeff Friend Trail.

title: Fun and Diverse Outdoor Park
text: Like many other reviewers, I absolutely LOVE this place. Gulf State Park is an incredibly diverse facility. Within a fairly reasonably sized footprint, you can enjoy camping, rental cabins, hiking and biking trails, numerous fishing sites including the pier on the Gulf beach, various birding opportunities including an active eagle's nest, and public beaches on the Gulf and on Lake Shelby. There is even a dog park at Lake Shelby for your pup to enjoy! There is also a really nice full service restaurant and several conveniently located public restrooms. Whether you are a local looking for ways to enjoy the great outdoors or a tourist looking for the same, this is your place! NOTE: Admission to the park is mostly free except for the Gulf fishing pier and the Gulf beach pavilion, both of which charge a nominal fee for admission.

title: Nature Walk in the Heart of Gulf Shores
text: If you are looking for something different to do in the touristy Gulf Shores area, this is a really great option. This is a small nature park right on the "main drag" in Gulf Shores. There are a few picnic tables and a really nice raised boardwalk over the marshy area where you can see alligators, turtles, birds and other wildlife. My only reason for the 4 star rating versus 5 is the challenging parking. Your best bet is to either park at a nearby restaurant (several are within easy walking distance of Wade Ward) and visit after your meal, or park at the spaces far behind the Pizza Hut right next door. This little park is a really nice oasis in the middle of all the beach crowds, so visit if you are looking for a free of charge change of pace.

title: Fresh, Affordable Seafood - A Hidden Gem!
text: I love this place. They consistently offer fresh seafood right out of the Gulf of Mexico at amazingly reasonable prices. This is a family run business on Highway 180 (aka Fort Morgan Road) next to the Dollar General. The owners and staff are great folks and aim to please for sure. We always find the seafood of excellent quality. We have always purchased raw seafood and prepared it ourselves, so I have not sampled their "prepared meals to go", but that service is available per their website. Give them a try and I'm confident you will agree with my 5 star rating!

title: #1 Rating Well Deserved
text: Big Fish is an anomaly for a resort town like Orange Beach. Despite being quite pricey compared to most of their Orange Beach peers, they consistently get really high ratings and have maintained their number 1 status through over one thousand reviews. I have traveled extensively and read or written hundreds of reviews from all over the world and this is extremely rare. It attests to how great this restaurant truly is. We dined here for dinner with some friends and enjoyed our evening immensely. Our party of 6 sampled various specialty cocktails, fine wines, sushi, salads, fresh fish and shellfish, followed by scrumptious deserts. Everything was incredibly well presented, fresh and tasty. The service was simply outstanding, even for a high end restaurant like this. Again, these are not "chap eats" but I'm confident you will find your experience well worth the money.

title: Great Takeout Food and Service
text: With inside dining shut down due to COVID, our only option these days is takeout. During a recent day enjoying the outdoors in Orange Beach (not on the actual beach as they were still CLOSED), I wanted a nice takeout lunch and found most of the Orange Beach restaurants were closed. Thank goodness for Tacky Jack's! They were still open for takeout and provided me with a wonderful shrimp po boy sandwich that I will not soon forget! My server was OUTSTANDING and I gave her a big tip. I have to say that the management folks I encountered were quite unfriendly though. Pretty disappointing considering I was an actual CUSTOMER, huh? Well, I won't hold that against them as these are hard times. I will definitely be back here again!

title: Great Turkish Food
text: We had lunch here during a cruise ship excursion and we were quite impressed. Though we had a big group, the service was personable and attentive. We so enjoyed all of the Turkish dishes that made up our "pre fixe" meal. Give them a try and you will be glad you did!

title: Good Airport Food
text: I honestly cannot explain all the bad reviews for this place. We found the service to be quite attentive and timely and the food was really good, considering the airport location. We had burgers and wine and were very pleased with the meal. Maybe we caught them on a good day, but I would recommend giving them a chance.

title: Where Locals Go
text: We stumbled onto this great little restaurant while walking around Naples. We noticed right away that most of the patrons were locals, known by name and food preference by the wait staff, a VERY good sign. The place is small and seating is quite condensed, so you will not find a lot of "free space" here, but you will experience great food and service in an authentic Neapolitan setting. They are located near the Piazza Bellini, named for the famous opera composer. We chose pizza and their house wines and were not disappointed. Honestly, we were not that impressed with Naples overall compared to other Italian cities, but our memory from this restaurant was the highlight of our day!

title: Beautiful Place To Shop
text: This building functions as a huge indoor mall with everything from high end designer stores and fine dining to a coffee shop and a McDonalds. The building is indeed an architectural marvel with stunning iron and glass as the main features. Located in the heart of busy Naples, Galleria Umberto is a great place to take a break from the crowded streets and weather.

title: Great Espresso and Pastries
text: As we wandered around the busy streets of Naples, we found this little place to be exactly what we needed. They are located in the Galleria Umberto, a gorgeous 19th century building now functioning as a huge indoor mall. They have seating out in the mall area and they provided excellent service. The espresso coffees were oh so good and the pastries even better. As a nice bonus, they have some seating in a quiet upstairs area and have clean restrooms to boot. A great find anywhere in Europe!

title: Lots Of Choices Here
text: Via Toledo is a great place to "window shop" and perhaps pick out a nice Naples souvenir. Some stores have the famous and expensive brand names and others have more reasonably priced items. Tons of great bars and restaurants are nearby for a "shopping break" as needed or desired. NOTE: Crowds can be really oppressive at peak times so plan accordingly. We went on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed!

title: Great Greek Fare And A Peaceful Setting
text: We had lunch here after a long morning of sightseeing in and around Athens. We found the service to be absolutely impeccable (our waiter had a great sense of humor!) and the simple, authentic Greek menu to be just what we needed. The appetizers and entrees were FANTASTIC and the Greek wine was even better! The setting is quite picturesque and peaceful, tucked away nicely just steps from a busy shopping district. A wonderful experience!

title: A "Must See" For Sure
text: The marvel that is the Parthenon is THE site you must see when in Athens. It stands as a testament to the amazing engineering and structural skills of the ancient Greeks. Just be aware of several things as you plan your day. (1) VERY crowded so go as early as possible. (2) The climb to the top can be demanding for some people. (3) The footing, especially near the Parthenon, can be quite uneven and hard to walk upon. (4) It can get quite windy up there, so bring a jacket even on a warm day. NOTE: As you ascend or descend, you get a very clear view of Mars Hill, where Paul preached the Gospel to the Athenians. A nice bonus!

title: A Bucket List Item For Sure
text: When you list great wonders of the ancient world, the Athens Acropolis is certainly at or near the top of the list. The Greek people have done an amazing job preserving and restoring much of the original structures here. NOTE: Restoration work is ongoing so be prepared for some ares to be closed off and construction cranes may be a challenge to omit from your photos. The site is simply amazing. The engineering skill used by the Greeks to create this place is incredible, especially given the era these structures were designed and built. NOTE: Crowds can be really bad so be prepared. The ascent to the Acropolis is steep and may not be suitable for everyone. Also, bring a jacket. The wind can be quite brisk up there even on a warm day.

title: Walk Where Paul Walked
text: The Apostle Paul and this ancient city are mentioned often in the Bible. His letter to the Ephesian church is one of the most quoted books in the New Testament. Also, the ancient Ephesus church is one of the seven churches addressed in the New Testament book of Revelation. We were so amazed at the quality of the restoration of this ancient city. It is truly a realistic glimpse into the ancient past. I would recommend a guided tour because there is SO MUCH detail that can be missed without a professional to point things out for you. This was one of the most enjoyable attractions of our entire Holy Land cruise. NOTE: Be aware that as you exit the property, there are numerous tents with very aggressive "hawkers" pushing really cheap merchandise. Indulge if you care for a trinket or two, and there are a couple of high quality shops among the trinket shops.

title: Pretty Amazing for non-Catholics Too
text: As some have said, this holy place where Mary the mother of Jesus Christ lived and died is a "must see" for those of the Catholic faith. I must say as a non-Catholic (Protestant) Christian, I was very moved by this visit for several reasons. First, the house is very small and simple, which one would expect from what we know of Mary. Second, the holy water springs and prayer notes wall add another simple, yet strong tone of validity and holiness to the place. And finally, we were treated to a brief Catholic mass in the small chapel at the rear of the property. It was amazing! The priest gave a wonderful, hard hitting sermon though it was only a few minutes long. For ALL believers in the Son of God, I highly recommend a visit. NOTE: The crowds can be overwhelming so be prepared to queue and wait for a bit to enter the house. NOTE: They have a snack bar and souvenir shop for your convenience. Enjoy!

title: Genuine and Affordable Greek Art
text: We stopped here after a cruise ship bus tour of Lindos. The shop is family owned and we were treated to a fun demonstration of the ceramic making art form. (Oh, and the "shop dog" is a scream so be sure ask to meet him!) After that, we had time to peruse the MANY diverse items on display. These are genuine art pieces at affordable prices, hand made right there in the shop. They have everything from tiny souvenir pieces to rather large urns and sculptures. I'm pretty sure they will ship your merchandise home but we opted for a small piece we could bring home in our luggage. If in the area, be sure and check this really cool place out. You will be glad you did!

title: Amazing History and Stunning Views
text: The Acropolis is by far the most significant attraction in Lindos. Be aware that the climb from the village up to the Acropolis is long and rather steep, and may not be suitable for everyone. NOTE: There are donkeys available to ride almost to the top for a nominal fee . If you decide to go, you won't be disappointed. For a small entrance fee, you will be treated to some of the most gorgeous views anywhere in Europe. I spent a solid hour at the summit and could have stayed longer. The historical significance of the Acropolis and associated temples and buildings is also amazing. We had a tour guide but I'm sure you can conduct a "do it yourself" tour as well. If in or near Lindos, do not miss this place if you can handle the physical strain. NOTE: I highly recommend bringing some bottled water for the climb and tour.

title: Another Greek Paradise
text: We spent several hours here during a cruise ship excursion and my oh my were we impressed! The Greek isles have many stunningly beautiful places and Lindos is one of the most gorgeous and historic you will see. The village sits high on a mountain, which made it a virtually impregnable fortress down through the ages. Through the centuries, Greeks, Turks and others have used Lindos as a strategically important city from a religious, cultural, governmental and military standpoint. Today, this small village is alive with thriving restaurants and shops. They certainly have their share of "trinket shops", but you can also find high quality Greek goods like fine linen and leather items. If day tripping, be aware that the streets are rather steep in places and the walk into town from the bus station is also very steep. I recommend using a cab for the steep climb back up to the buses. If you are interested in staying here, they have some amazing hotels and gorgeous beaches adjacent to the village. Spending several days here would be a dream!

title: A Great Place to Rest
text: While wandering around the shopping area of Limassol, we stumbled onto this really cool place to take a break and "beat the heat". They are located in the heart of the shopping area and feature outdoor dining under a substantial roof for protection from the elements. They offer very comfortable seating in a fun and festive environment. Service is great and the menu features several local specialties and even better, local wines! We also loved the fact that several cats quietly rule this location! A really fun place for a drink and some eats!

title: Holy Place, Gorgeous Grounds & Church
text: This site features a beautiful and fairly new church at the site of Jesus’ Sermon on the Mount. It is a gorgeous setting with acres of beautiful landscaping, amazing views of Sea of Galilee and surrounding landscapes, numerous clean restrooms and nice gift shop. From the parking area, you can take a nice stroll up the hill to where the church sits, commemorating where He preached the most famous sermon of all time. You will be glad you came here.

title: Amazing Site Restoration and Holy History
text: Wow, what a great place this is! The archeological site has been professionally and carefully excavated and the remains are simply one of the coolest treasures we saw in the entire Holy Land! We were on a guided tour and learned this was where Jesus lived for a while with the apostle Peter's mother-in-law. The house has been excavated and you can see where He actually sat, prayed, and ate meals. Incredible! The site also includes an excavated Jewish synagogue, so you can get a feel for worship practices of the Jews in those days. This amazing site has a working church, so be aware you may have to vacate that church above “Peter’s mother in law house” during worship services. They also have clean restrooms, a snack bar and a gift shop. All in all, a great place to spend a couple of hours away from the maddening crowds.

title: Beautiful, Simple and Holy
text: While this quaint little church is nothing too fancy, especially compared to many of the more ornate Holy Land churches, it has its own very special appeal. The ancient structure commemorates where Jesus performed the miracle of feeding five thousand people from just a few loaves and fishes. Inside you will see the rock where Jesus served the masses from, original Byzantine floor mosaics, and other ancient, historical relics. This is a very quiet and holy quiet site with a nice gift shop to boot. This attraction, like several in Galilee, serves as a nice respite from the maddening crowds in Jerusalem, Bethlehem and other more famous places.

title: What a Memorable Kibbutz Meal!
text: We stopped in here for lunch during a tour of Galilee and had a wonderful meal! The restaurant is located in the main hotel building. As a bonus, the hotel offers some high end shopping on the main floor just a few steps away from the restaurant. The food was served buffet style and highlighted many of the culinary specialties of the region. I must say the diversity and quality was FAR beyond my expectations of most buffets. The food was simply OUTSTANDING! Note that if you want a soft drink or wine, those beverages are sold separately from a beverage cart.

title: A Unique Baptismal Experience
text: Yardenit offers a unique spiritual opportunity like no other. For simply the cost of a rented baptismal robe (unless you bring your own), you can be baptized in the River Jordan, where Christ Himself was baptized by John the Baptist. Note that this is not the exact site where Jesus was baptized, but it is indeed the same river. The site is well maintained and very well run. There are large dressing/rest room areas near the river for changing your clothing before and after your baptism. They also feature a really nice gift shop with both inexpensive and high end merchandise. We purchased a gorgeous hand-carved olive wood rendering of Christ and the apostles in a fishing boat. If in Galilee, try and include Yardenit and you won't be disappointed.

title: Beautiful and Holy Place
text: We started a long day of seeing Biblical sites throughout Galilee with this church, and we were not disappointed. The church sits in what is now "downtown" Nazareth where Mary was first told by the Angel Gabriel that she, a virgin, would give birth to the Son of God. The church, though quite old, is very beautiful from the outside and includes amazing gardens and landscaping all around. As you enter, don't miss the HUGE amazing doors with engraved Bible scenes. The doors themselves are a wonder to behold. Once inside, there are several treasures to explore. In the large sanctuary, there are numerous incredible paintings and mosaics from numerous countries dedicated to Mary. On another level, you can view the grotto where Gabriel appeared to Mary. You can also see where Joseph, Mary's carpenter husband, lived with the family. As a nice bonus, there are numerous clean restrooms an area right outside the church. Plan to devote a couple of hours here to fully appreciate this wonderful and holy place.

title: In Christ's Steps - Wow!
text: I wish we had had more time to really enjoy and soak this in. Walking on this incredibly narrow and steep street where He walked, bearing His cross, was awe-inspiring. There are several "stations" highlighted along the way. I would suggest trying to go very early or late and miss the maddening crowds.
place: The Way of the Cross - Via Dolorosa

title: So Disappointing
text: I have to say I agree with many of my fellow reviewers. This place should be solemn and holy, but is not. The crowds and pushing are bad enough, but the "gold and glitter" seem completely out of place. I hate to say it, but I am not sure these places are actually what "they" claim them to be, i.e., the holy places of Christ's death and resurrection. I'm glad I went, but man was I disappointed overall!

title: LOVED This Area!
text: Candidly, we found the Jewish Quarter of Old Jerusalem to be our favorite area by far. It tends to be much more "calm" than other areas of the old city. Lots of food options abound. The shops seem of higher quality and there is far less "hawking" than some Old Jerusalem locations. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our short time here.

title: A Holy, Holy Place
text: We visited the Wall as we were exiting Old Jerusalem. The sun was setting as we approached this very holy and moving area. The mood here was vastly different than anywhere else in the city. People of all 3 faiths were there praying. You could literally feel God's presence. Unlike other Old Jerusalem sites, there is plenty of open space so you can take your time and really enjoy your time there. Just a couple of items to be aware of. Men and women pray on different sides (men on the left, women on the right), so be prepared to split up and rejoin your group. Men,be sure for me to grab a yamaka from the kiosk as you approach the Wall as men are REQUIRED to have some sort of head covering. Also, when you are done, DO NOT turn your back on the Wall, but instead back away from the wall for a few paces while still facing it. Follow these tips and you will be able to enjoy your visit AND honor these ancient customs.

title: Certainly A Must Do - But Too Crowded
text: As a Christian, my visit to Old Jerusalem was a HUGE bucket list item. Seeing and walking where Jesus actually walked, and more importantly where he was crucified and raised from the dead, was awe-inspiring beyond words. While I am certainly glad I did it, there were several disappointing facets too hard to ignore. The crowds were terribly oppressive and at times downright scary. Because of the throngs of humanity, it was impossible to spend more than a few minutes viewing and soaking up each site. Also, the numerous merchants hawking cheap, tourist trap merchandise was disgusting. I had to think about how Christ threw the "moneychangers" out of the temple during His ministry. if in the Holy Land, you simply have to visit here, but be prepared for the less than perfect conditions.

title: Good Food and Efficient Service
text: We had lunch here with a large tour group right after visiting The Church of the Nativity. The service was quick and efficient and the food was good. Certainly not the best meal we had in the Holy Land, but it hit the spot during an otherwise very busy day. They are very close to the Church of the Nativity, located across a square directly across the street. There is also ample shopping nearby.

title: Simply A Holy Land Must-Do
text: This gorgeous old church sits atop the birthplace of Christ. It's significance to Christians and others is beyond comprehension. The structure has undergone many changes through the centuries but the original "holy place" feel has been maintained. Once inside, there will likely be a VERY long line to see the actual birth grotto, probably around a 2 hour wait, so plan accordingly. There are actually several churches under the one roof that meet and have regular services. We really enjoyed the Catholic church, which is located through a separate doorway into a beautiful garden area. Also note that you actually leave Israel to visit Bethlehem, as it is located in Palestine. There were no issues crossing the border while we were there, but it might be a good idea to check ahead just to make sure.

title: Still A Great Breakfast Option
text: Julwin's has been around for decades and they still manage to deliver good quality breakfast fare at reasonable prices. The menu is quite diverse for a small locals-favorite place, including some really good omelette options. The seafood based one with shrimp and lump crabmeat is my favorite. Yum! They are conveniently located in the heart of the Fairhope shopping and entertainment district. Whether you are a local or a visitor, give them a try.

title: Good Food and Incredible Views
text: We stopped in here during a tour of Taormina and we were so glad we did. We had a glass of wine and a light appetizer. But the view was the "star of the show"! Wow, what amazing views from their outdoor seating! Note that the restaurant is connected to the hotel with great restrooms downstairs, a really nice artisan shop upstairs, and other amenities.

title: Greco-Roman Theater
text: We toured this theater at the end of a walking tour of Taormina. While very impressive, it's hard to get a really good view of the entire theater. Try and get to a high vantage point so you can enjoy the true ambiance of this historical and very special place.

title: Still a B'ham/Mtn. Brook Classic
text: We had a wonderful brunch here and it brought back some great memories. I had not been to Chez Lulu in several years but this brunch was like coming home. This is a really special place. Very unpretentious, yet oh so classy. The menu is very French bistro, but not a bit haughty. The service is always attentive and outstanding. And the wine list is simply a PERFECT, affordable match to their creative menu. Stray from the crowds and try this little place in English Village and you will not be disappointed. They are truly a B'ham classic!

title: Great Food Off The Beaten Path
text: Tin Top has been one of our favorites for years. They are located "off the beaten path" in the Bon Secour area not far from Highway 59, the main drag into Gulf Shores and Orange Beach, Alabama. I recently had lunch there and things have not changed. They offer amazing seafood and other fare at reasonable prices. The wine list is outstanding and they also have full bar and several craft and draft beers as well. One of my favorites is the seafood-stuffed mushrooms, INCREDIBLE! Note that they now have a small butcher/fresh seafood shop adjacent to the restaurant where you can order items to bring home. Give them a try and you won't be disappointed!
place: The Tin Top Restaurant and Oyster Bar

title: Recommended by Locals
text: I found this wonderful restaurant via a recommendation by hotel porter, NOT the concierge! The porter, obviously a local, was dead on with that recommendation! For starters, they have an amazing wine list, including Amarone by the glass and other great wines. The menu features very reasonable prices, and this place is a favorite of locals. They have been here since 1911 and were one of first restaurants to open after WWII. Kristina served and was awesome. She was very personable and knowledgeable of the menu. I decided on the spaghetti and “small” meatballs and it was oh so good! I also had the cheese and chocolate cake for desert and it was a major hit! You cannot miss this place if you are in the area!

title: You WILL Be Impressed!
text: In an ancient city with literally hundreds of hotels, it's hard to find somewhere "special", but the Excelsior pulls it off. Note the nostalgic photos of Paul Newman and Sophia Loren at the Excelsior in the elevators. The Excelsior is very luxurious throughout with lots of amenities. They offer nice, updated rooms, some with windows that actually open for nice ambiance. They are in an excellent location within walking distance of many great restaurants and several attractions including the Trevi Fountain and Terminni train station. Note that they are one hour plus from airport, so do not expect a quick trip once you've landed due to traffic.

title: Make Time for Murano!
text: Venice has SO many things to do and see, it is difficult to make time for "side trips", such as the small island of Murano. Murano is best known for the glass-blowing factories, galleries and shops, but it offers so much more. Murano is a short vaporetto (public water bus) or water taxi ride from Venice. We skipped the glass blowing factories and demonstrations and went straight for the galleries and shops. Oh my, what amazing diversity and beauty in the masterpieces they produce, large and small. There are some great restaurants, beautiful churches and quiet residential areas as well. You will be glad you took the time to visit!

title: Inexpensive Sightseeing
text: This is your reliable and inexpensive ticket to some great sightseeing in Venice. In addition to being a good way to get around, Vaporetto offers amazing views of the Venice Grand Canal and the Venice lagoon and surrounding islands. Do some research ahead of time as they offer several types of day passes. If you want to be assured of a seat, board before the most crowded stops at Rialto, St. Marks and the train station.

title: BEST Restaurant in Murano
text: We had lunch here based on a recommendation from a local, and we were so impressed. Carlos served us and did a great job. "B" is rated number 1 in Murano and I can clearly see why. The restaurant is located in a quiet square away from the crowds. We loved their house wine, a Ribolla Giella from the Friuli region. We dined on the daily special which was linguine with monk fish. My wife had a wonderful pizza and we enjoyed the bruschetta as an amazing appetizer. If in Murano, this is YOUR place for a great meal!

title: Yummy Gelato
text: This is a nice place to grab a tasty gelato as you walk around Venice. Lots of great flavors to choose from, and the prices are quite reasonable.

title: Make Time to Do This! What a Show!
text: If you can and the schedule works out, you MUST make time to see an opera or some other live performance at this gorgeous and historic opera house. Teatro has an amazing history. As you enter here, you feel like you are actually "going back in time". The theater is very chic and warm all at the same time. They offer wine, coffee and snacks before the performance and during intermission. We were fortunate to attend a performance of La Traviata, one of the most famous Italian operas. The theater shows English “sub titles” above the stage to help you "interpret" the Italian opera lyrics.

title: Canal-side Dining with Good Food
text: We stumbled onto this place during our last evening in Venice. The setting is amazing, situated beside a quiet canal. Several gondolas will drift by during your meal. We had the lasagna and cheese plate. Both were good, not great. Be aware that their house wines are just ok, so I suggest you order something off of the wine list. Bottom line, the setting is great, the food is just good.

title: Renaissance Art at its BEST!
text: If you can, try and budget some time to visit this really nice museum. The museum is in the Dorsoduro area, across the Academia Bridge from the very busy touristy areas of Venice. You will be treated to amazing Renaissance art including incredible works by Bellini and other famous masters. We really enjoyed the signature Venetian pieces featuring incredible paintings of ancient Venice. NOTE: Try to avoid the crowds since the museum only allows a certain number of patrons. They also require a bag check for backpacks and larger bags. There is nearby gondola station for a nice, quiet gondola ride before or after your visit.

title: Canal-side Dining and The Bridge of Sighs
text: This is a really quaint restaurant in a unique location. They have outside tables (I highly recommend you try and get one) that sit right along a quiet little canal where gondolas come by from time to time. The place is really magical at night. From here, you can actually see the famous Bridge of Sighs down the canal from where you are sitting. The food is good but not great, but they do take good care of you with excellent service. We had the porcini mushrooms pasta and calamari. Both were good, but not the best we had in Venice.
